page.title: 10 A Shoe Factory
page.content: We visited a typical Rushden shoe factory It was larger than most in the area, well-established, designing and making its own shoes. These shoes are sold in Britain and all over the world. Over 200 processes go into the making of one shoe. The factory was very noisy and some of the machines looked very dangerous. Leather they use comes from cows,snakes,ostriches,young goats, calves and rhino's. We found that 80% of the workers came from Rushden. Some came on the firm's bus from Irchester, others came from Kettering, Northampton and Wellingb'gh. We surveyed factories in the area, as many have closed during the last few years. Greater competition with foreign imports has caused this. We found 14 factories in our block; 10 still made shoes, 2 had changed products, 2 had closed completely.
